snippet: Fourteen slaves who petitioned the Legislature for their freedom during the Revolutionary War were granted posthumous emancipation on Friday when Gov. Maggie Hassan signed a largely symbolic bill.
abstract: Fourteen slaves who petitioned New Hampshire Legislature for their freedom during Revolutionary War are granted posthumous emancipation when Gov Maggie Hassan signs largely symbolic bill; supporters hope gesture will encourage future generations to pursue social justice.
lead_paragraph: Fourteen slaves who petitioned the Legislature for their freedom during the Revolutionary War were granted posthumous emancipation on Friday when Gov. Maggie Hassan signed a largely symbolic bill.
